Silently discard characters that cannot be converted instead of terminating when

au_814904: shopt -s globstar  ## Enables recursive glob matching
for f in **/*.txt; do
    iconv -f gbk -t utf8 -o "${f%.txt}".wiki "$f" && rm "$f"
done

shopt -s globstar  ## Enables recursive glob matching
for f in **/*.txt; do
    out="$(iconv -f gbk -t utf8 "$f")" 
    [[ -n $out ]] && echo "$out" >"${f%.txt}".wiki && rm "$f"
done
so_9310571: find . -type f -print -exec iconv -f iso8859-2 -t utf-8 -o {}.converted {} \; -exec mv {}.converted {} \;

Explanations about Options.--mime(M):
Causes the file command to output mime type strings rather than the more traditional
 human readable ones. Thus it may say ‘text/plain; charset=us-ascii’ rather than
 “ASCII text”.
Explanations about Options.-b(M): Do not prepend filenames to output lines (brief mode).
Explanations about Options.-i(M):
Causes the file command to output mime type strings rather than the more traditional
 human readable ones. Thus it may say ‘text/plain; charset=us-ascii’ rather than
 “ASCII text”.
